abstract: Study by Pew Research Center's Forum on Religion and Public Life finds that for the first time, fewer than half of Americans say they are Protestants, a steep decline from 40 years ago when two-thirds of the population were members; report also shows that nearly 20 percent say they are atheist, agnostic or 'nothing in particular.'
lead_paragraph: The study also found that nearly one in five Americans identify as atheist, agnostic or “nothing in particular,” a seismic shift from 50 years ago.
